title: Ticket #3605: 32-bit condor fails to execute jobs on large filesystem
description:
When the job's initial working directory is on a filesystem with 64-bit values in the stat struct, execution of jobs by a 32-bit build of condor can fail with this error: 

    Failed to execute 'executable' with arguments blah:
    Cannot access specified iwd "/execute/dir/dir_23676" (errno=75: 'Value too large for defined data type')

The problem is in DaemonCore. Before the job is executed, the existence of the working directory is tested with a call to stat(). This source file does not define _FILE_OFFSET_BITS to 64.
